page.title: 03Housing in Taverham
page.content: Most of{Taverham's}houses have been built within the last 20 yrs. and development is continuing around{Beech {Avenue.}The council houses along{Sandy {Lane}were all built in 1931. Several houses in{The Street}were built >200 yrs ago.{'Leighside',}formerly{'The {Papermakers' Arms'}was built 250 yrs ago. 20 out of 39 people interviewed had{double glazing}and 16 out of 37 had{cavity wall insulation.}Out of 82 people interviewed about{house heating 63 used gas, 4 oil, 7 electricity and 8 coal. 'Our house is 25 yrs old. We have lived here for 4 yrs. We have double glazing and cavity wall insulation. We use gas heating. We have had a loft conversion increasing the space by 40% There are 2 bedrooms, a bathroom and an airing cupboard built on so we have 9 rooms altogether.'(Emma Margitson's)
